description:
An example showing how we can visually show what type of protection is offerred by an object carried.

The code in the Onload editor is

INSERT_ONLOAD

The code in the Pre editor is

INSERT_PRE

We suggest that you try to run the following program

INSERT_EDITOR
onload:
# Python code in onload
RUR.onload_set_programming_language("python")

# We re-use the token image for two new objects
RUR.add_new_thing({"name": "water protection",
    "url": "src/images/token.png",
    "protections": ["water"]})
RUR.add_new_thing({"name": "fire protection",
    "url": "src/images/token.png",
    "protections": ["fire"]})

RUR.add_object("water protection", 2, 1)
RUR.add_background_tile("water", 4, 1)
RUR.add_object("fire protection", 7, 1)
RUR.add_background_tile("fire", 9, 1)
editor:

take()

move()

take()
